meanings.definition: To compose or recite an elegy.
meanings.sent1: She spent hours elegising the memory of her beloved pet.
meanings.sent2: The poet elegised the fallen soldiers in his moving verses.
meanings.sent3: At the funeral, he elegised with such emotion that even strangers were moved.
meanings.sent4: Her elegising voice filled the room with a sense of loss and remembrance.
meanings.sent5: The old man elegised the changing seasons with a melancholic tone.

meanings.definition: The act of writing or performing elegies.
meanings.sent1: Her elegising of historical figures captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: The elegising at the memorial service brought tears to many eyes.
meanings.sent3: The children put on a playful elegising performance for their parents.
meanings.sent4: The elegising of the poet echoed through the halls of the museum.
meanings.sent5: The solemn elegising of the choir filled the church with a sense of reverence.
